comments.comment:
Not right mate. I had a trust with you but not anymore. Read below.
If Gota gets 49%,¬†

Sajith gets 24% because only UNP

Anura gets 26%

Others get 1%

Anura will win in 2nd pref. Explain below.

Gota & Anura will lead as 1st and 2nd in first roud. No clear winner of 50% then goes to 2nd preference.¬†

If we convince UNP and other parties voters to mark 2 for Anura, it is not hard for them to do so, because pure UNP hate SLFP and never vote for Gota. They will happily mark 2 for Anura.¬†

Final score after 2nd preferences will be ;

Gota remains at 49%

Sajith will out as 3rd will not count.

Anura 26% +¬† minimum 25% of 2nd preference = 51%

So, to achieve final equation, Anura must be the 2nd by getting progressive SLFP votes which were voted to Sirisena in 2015 plus all united vikalpaya votes except Gota's extreme voters as well as pure UNP voters. Currently it was estimated as 40% of total.¬† ¬†

We must ask UNP to mark 2 for Anura.¬† Also not to mark for anyone other than Anura. Please make it happen.


2015 Election results analysis;

Go with facts not with rumors.

Sirisena got 51.28%, votes 6217k

Raja got 47.58%, votes 5768k

K= thousands

Gota might take a bit of SLFP progressive but never be able to get over 50%.

Assuming he will break progressive 2%, he still cannot exceed 50% in first round.

2015 progressive voters other than pure UNPs who wanting a better country are at least half of 2015 Sirisena's.¬†

In this case, if¬† Anura come as united vikalpaya in2019, he will break Sirisena's 51.28%. This mean Sirisena's 51.28% in 2015 will become 51.28 minus 2% to Gota = 49.28%, and half of this is 24.64%. In 2016 Swan Sajith will end up at 25%.¬†

It is going to be a tough fight to be the second but Anura will win narrowly if he get full support from vikalpa votes. Thats all we need. It will goto 2nd preference and Gota will have none 2nds but all 2nd pref to Anura. 26% + 24% + other 1% = 51%.

So, challenge is to break Swan Sajith voters not Gota as to become 2nd. No need to be first at first round but explain Swan voters to mark second preference to Anura.
comments.author: Chapa Pemmal
